command: sudo bash -c 'tcpdump -ni eth0 -l "arp and ether src 00:de:ad:be:ef:00 and arp[6:2]=2" -c 1 && vtysh -c "conf t" -c "ip route 192.168.200.0/24 192.0.2.254"'
explanation: Treats a gratuitous ARP reply from a specific MAC as a layer-2 magic signal, then adds a static route via vtysh to enable a hidden path. Detection: baseline ARP behavior on infra ports and alert on unexpected ARP replies from unusual MACs coupled with new route insertions.
rationale_steps: Listen for a crafted ARP reply from a preselected MAC address as the trigger.
On match, perform a configuration change by adding a static route using vtysh.
Detect with ARP monitoring/DAI and FRR configuration change audits.
